decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly ramping up a strong, hexproof creature with various powerful auras to make it hard to deal with. By protecting the creature with cards like Leyline of Sanctity and Spirit Mantle, while boosting its power with Ethereal Armor and Rancor, it aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and hard-hitting threat. The efficient use of auras and hexproof creatures allows for a aggressive and resilient strategy that can quickly close out games before the opponent has a chance to respond.

The main concept of the deck is to aggressively deal direct damage to the opponent using fast and efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Boros Charm, while also deploying creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear to apply pressure and further enhance the damage output. The inclusion of cards like Skullcrack and Eidolon of the Great Revel helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan and prevent them from gaining life or casting spells comfortably. The deck aims to win the game quickly by overwhelming the opponent with consistent damage and efficient threats.

The main objective of this deck is to quickly cheat large creatures into play using cards like Through the Breach, Goryo's Vengeance, and Nourishing Shoal. By discarding creatures like Worldspine Wurm and Griselbrand, players can reanimate them for a powerful combo finish. The deck also utilizes cards like Faithless Looting and Night's Whisper to dig for combo pieces and generate card advantage. With the ability to bring out huge threats early in the game, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win before they can establish their own game plan.

This UW Control deck focuses on using a combination of counterspells, removal, and card draw to control the pace of the game. With a mix of removal spells like Path to Exile, Lightning Helix, and Supreme Verdict, along with counters like Negate and Logic Knot, the deck can handle a variety of threats. Card advantage is gained through cards like Serum Visions, Azcanta, and Snapcaster Mage, allowing the player to maintain control over the game. By carefully managing resources and controlling the opponent's board, this deck seeks to outlast and outmaneuver its opponents.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize artifact creatures and equipment to quickly deal damage to the opponent. By playing multiple cheap artifacts, the deck aims to power up creatures like Vault Skirge and Signal Pest with Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer. The deck also includes Arcbound Ravager for additional flexibility and reach. The mana base is made up of a combination of artifact lands like Darksteel Citadel and man lands like Inkmoth Nexus to ensure consistent mana production. Ultimately, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient equipment.

The focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent through efficient burn spells and aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt, Boros Charm, and Lava Spike, along with fast creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Guide, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early on and finish the game before the opponent can stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Searing Blaze also helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan and prevent them from gaining momentum.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful board presence of Elves and utilizing cards like Collected Company and Chord of Calling to quickly find combo pieces such as Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies. By generating large amounts of mana and utilizing cards like Ezuri, Renegade Leader, the deck can overwhelm opponents with a massive army of Elves, often leading to a quick and decisive victory. The lands in the deck help to fix mana and provide additional utility to ensure the combo can be executed smoothly.

This deck focuses on utilizing Death's Shadow as a powerful threat, supported by disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to control the opponent's hand. The deck also uses cards like Mishra's Bauble and Street Wraith to enable Death's Shadow to come down as a large threat quickly. The deck aims to apply early pressure and close out games quickly through the use of aggro cards like Temur Battle Rage and Tarmogoyf. The deck also includes a toolbox of lands to support its mana base and help search for key cards.

The key strategy of this Amulet Titan deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Amulet of Vigor and bounce lands like Simic Growth Chamber to cheat out powerful threats like Primeval Titan. By utilizing cards like Ancient Stirrings and Explore, the deck can dig for key pieces while also developing its board state. With the ability to tutor for key cards with Tolaria West and Summoner's Pact, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures and win through combo or sheer aggression. Additionally, the deck features a toolbox of lands like Vesuva and Bojuka Bog to adapt to various matchups.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of aggressive Humans and disruptive creatures to overwhelm opponents quickly. By leveraging cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Meddling Mage to slow down opponents, while building up a board presence with creatures like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant, the deck aims to deal damage efficiently and consistently. Aether Vial provides additional flexibility and speed in getting creatures onto the battlefield, allowing for explosive plays. The mana base is optimized for casting predominantly Human creatures, ensuring a smooth and consistent flow of threats.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's strategies while setting up the combo of Through the Breach and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn to quickly end the game. Nahiri, the Harbinger provides another win condition and card advantage through her abilities. The deck also includes versatile cards like Snapcaster Mage and Cryptic Command to adapt to different situations and ensure control over the game. Overall, the deck aims to control the game until it can execute its powerful combo or win through other means.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats from the board, and drawing cards. It uses cards like Cryptic Command, Snapcaster Mage, and Serum Visions to maintain card advantage and react to the opponent's plays. The win condition can either be through attacking with Celestial Colonnade or generating a large army with Secure the Wastes. The inclusion of Planeswalkers like Nahiri, the Harbinger provides additional card selection and removal options. Ultimately, the goal is to outvalue and outlast the opponent through careful decision-making and resource management.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively disrupt the opponent's game plan with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while also applying pressure with efficient creatures like Young Pyromancer and Bedlam Reveler. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push to control the board, as well as versatile cards like Kolaghan's Command for additional value. Overall, the goal is to apply early pressure, disrupt the opponent's plans, and close out the game quickly with a combination of threats and removal.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive approach, utilizing Young Pyromancer and Bedlam Reveler to create tokens and draw cards. This deck also includes disruption elements like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to control the opponent's hand, as well as removal spells like Lightning Bolt, Terminate, and Fatal Push to deal with threats. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Lingering Souls and Liliana of the Veil provides additional value and versatility. Finally, cards like Blood Moon and Kolaghan's Command add an extra layer of disruption and flexibility to the deck strategy.

This deck focuses on early disruption and removal spells to control the board while deploying efficient threats such as Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant to quickly close out the game. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while also generating card advantage with Dark Confidant and Tireless Tracker. The inclusion of Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope provides additional disruption and recursion, making it difficult for the opponent to stabilize and mount a comeback.

The main focus of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly in order to play Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Primeval Titan as soon as possible. The goal is to use Scapeshift to sacrifice lands and deal a large amount of damage to the opponent with Valakut triggers. This combo is supported by cards like Search for Tomorrow, Farseek, and Sakura-Tribe Elder to ensure that the player can quickly assemble the pieces needed to win the game. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Anger of the Gods and Lightning Bolt for removal and control.
